label: Interviewee: Contextualizing, Relating Firsthand Experience, Relating Personal Detail, Hesitation, Tone Change

body.value: And Bob was, if you if you see the movie, All the President's Men, he was the one black face in The Washington Post, in that experience. But I knew him, and he had come out to my house. That house that I told you about that I bought and Grand Terrace used to be segregated. Bob was there for a party after a journalism day we had at The University of the Redlands. We became friends. And then so when he got named editor of the The Oakland Tribune, I was completely it was really a surprise. Gannett kind of gave him that paper to be editor. And then he wound up buying it, because the paper was...having trouble. *quiets down*. It was the end of an era.
